message.translation: New and easy way to connect to the wireless router using Wi-Fi Protected Setup (WPS)
message.variable: New and easy way to connect to the wireless router using Wi-Fi Protected Setup (WPS)

message.translation: A wireless client has to support the WPS function if you want to use this wizard to add the client to your WPS-enabled wireless router.
message.variable: A wireless client has to support the WPS function if you want to use this wizard to add the client to your WPS-enabled wireless router.

message.translation: Please check the user manual and gift box of your wireless client to see whether it supports the WPS function.
message.variable: Please check the user manual and gift box of your wireless client to see whether it supports the WPS function.

message.translation: If your wireless client does not support the WPS function, you have to configure your wireless client manually so that it has the same SSID and wireless security settings as this router.
message.variable: If your wireless client does not support the WPS function, you have to configure your wireless client manually so that it has the same SSID and wireless security settings as this router.

message.translation: The NETGEAR mobile broadband router must be configured after it is connected into your network. You can do this using the Setup Wizard -- where the wizard will attempt to make the connection to the Internet service through your ISP -- or you can configure the router manually. It is recommended that, if you aren't used to setting up Internet connections, you let the Setup Wizard do some of the work for you.
message.variable: The NETGEAR mobile broadband router must be configured after it is connected into your network. You can do this using the Setup Wizard -- where the wizard will attempt to make the connection to the Internet service through your ISP -- or you can configure the router manually. It is recommended that, if you aren't used to setting up Internet connections, you let the Setup Wizard do some of the work for you.

message.variable: No DSL Cable Is Plugged into the Router ADSL Port

message.translation: Make sure that the cable is securely plugged into both the broadband modem port and the router Internet port.
message.variable: Make sure that the cable is securely plugged into both the broadband modem port and the router Internet port.

message.translation: After you have checked the DSL cable, click Try again.
message.variable: After you have checked the DSL cable, click Try again.

message.translation: Incorrect ISP User name or Password
message.variable: Incorrect ISP User name or Password

message.translation: I want to configure the Internet connection myself
message.variable: I want to configure the Internet connection myself

message.translation: This process can take a few minutes; please wait …
message.variable: This process can take a few minutes; please wait …

message.translation: This is most likely due to one of the following reasons:
message.variable: This is most likely due to one of the following reasons:

message.translation: 1. The modem was not power cycled during the cabling step.
message.variable: 1. The modem was not power cycled during the cabling step.

message.translation: To solve this problem, power cycle the modem (turn it off and on). To power cycle a modem with battery backup, you might need to remove and reinsert its battery. After the power cycle, wait 2 minutes for the modem to completely start up.
message.variable: To solve this problem, power cycle the modem (turn it off and on). To power cycle a modem with battery backup, you might need to remove and reinsert its battery. After the power cycle, wait 2 minutes for the modem to completely start up.

message.translation: 2. The yellow Ethernet cable is not fully inserted, or is inserted in the wrong place.
message.variable: 2. The yellow Ethernet cable is not fully inserted, or is inserted in the wrong place.

message.translation: To solve this problem, make sure that the yellow Ethernet cable is securely plugged in to the broadband modem port and the router Internet port.
message.variable: To solve this problem, make sure that the yellow Ethernet cable is securely plugged in to the broadband modem port and the router Internet port.

message.translation: I just power cycled the modem and waited for 2 minutes.
message.variable: I just power cycled the modem and waited for 2 minutes.

message.translation: I corrected a problem with the Ethernet cable.
message.variable: I corrected a problem with the Ethernet cable.

message.translation: Problem Detecting the Internet Connection - IP Address
message.variable: Problem Detecting the Internet Connection - IP Address

message.translation: Did your Internet Service Provider (ISP) assign to you a fixed (static) IP address? This is a very rare special deployment.
message.variable: Did your Internet Service Provider (ISP) assign to you a fixed (static) IP address? This is a very rare special deployment.

message.translation: Select an option and click Next to proceed.
message.variable: Select an option and click Next to proceed.

message.translation: Yes. My ISP assigned a fixed (static) IP address to me.
message.variable: Yes. My ISP assigned a fixed (static) IP address to me.

message.translation: No, I did not get a fixed (static) IP address from my ISP.
message.variable: No, I did not get a fixed (static) IP address from my ISP.

message.translation: Enter the fixed IP settings assigned by your Internet Service Provider and click Next to proceed.
message.variable: Enter the fixed IP settings assigned by your Internet Service Provider and click Next to proceed.

message.translation: Problem Detecting the Internet Connection - MAC Address
message.variable: Problem Detecting the Internet Connection - MAC Address

message.translation: If you previously connected to your Internet service with a computer or another router, NETGEAR Genie can use the same MAC address that worked before.
message.variable: If you previously connected to your Internet service with a computer or another router, NETGEAR Genie can use the same MAC address that worked before.

message.translation: A MAC address is a unique number. You can find the MAC address of the computer or router on its product label.
message.variable: A MAC address is a unique number. You can find the MAC address of the computer or router on its product label.

message.translation: Browse to the router settings backup file you previously saved, and click Next to proceed.
message.variable: Browse to the router settings backup file you previously saved, and click Next to proceed.

message.translation: Checking the Internet connection; please wait …
message.variable: Checking the Internet connection; please wait …

message.translation: The router cannot connect to the Internet with the current settings.
message.variable: The router cannot connect to the Internet with the current settings.

message.translation: - Check that the cable connections are correct. Refer to the router Installation Guide for instructions.
message.variable: - Check that the cable connections are correct. Refer to the router Installation Guide for instructions.

message.translation: - Check that your broadband modem is power cycled correctly. If you have a battery-backed modem, remove and reinsert the battery to power cycle your modem.
message.variable: - Check that your broadband modem is power cycled correctly. If you have a battery-backed modem, remove and reinsert the battery to power cycle your modem.

message.translation: Do you want NETGEAR Genie to try again?
message.variable: Do you want NETGEAR Genie to try again?

message.translation: This router is preset with the following unique wireless network name (SSID) and
message.variable: This router is preset with the following unique wireless network name (SSID) and

message.translation: Your router is preset with WPA2-PSK wireless security to protect your network from unwanted access. To join the wireless network, you must enter the network key (password). These preset settings are unique to this device, like a serial number. If you want to change them, you can do so later in the Wireless Settings screen on the router web GUI.
message.variable: Your router is preset with WPA2-PSK wireless security to protect your network from unwanted access. To join the wireless network, you must enter the network key (password). These preset settings are unique to this device, like a serial number. If you want to change them, you can do so later in the Wireless Settings screen on the router web GUI.

message.translation: Wireless security is not enabled on this router. NETGEAR highly recommends that you
message.variable: Wireless security is not enabled on this router. NETGEAR highly recommends that you

message.translation: A new firmware upgrade is available. Click here to get it.
message.variable: A new firmware upgrade is available. Click here to get it.

message.translation: The ReadySHARE Cloud feature gives you remote access over the Internet to a USB storage device that is connected to your router's USB port.
message.variable: The ReadySHARE Cloud feature gives you remote access over the Internet to a USB storage device that is connected to your router's USB port.

message.translation: How to Set Up ReadySHARE Cloud
message.variable: How to Set Up ReadySHARE Cloud

message.translation: Step 1: You need a ReadySHARE Cloud account. If you do not have one,click here to get one.
message.variable: Step 1: You need a ReadySHARE Cloud account. If you do not have one,click here to get one.

message.translation: Start now to enable ReadySHARE Cloud
message.variable: Start now to enable ReadySHARE Cloud

message.translation: If you don't have a ReadySHARE Cloud account click here to get one
message.variable: If you don't have a ReadySHARE Cloud account click here to get one

message.translation: Note: Internet will be kept active until unregistered.
message.variable: Note: Internet will be kept active until unregistered.

message.translation: Note: Without this client, you can browse your USB device contents but you cannot open files or make changes to them.
message.variable: Note: Without this client, you can browse your USB device contents but you cannot open files or make changes to them.

message.translation: ReadySHARE Cloud (Allows you to access ReadySHARE Storage from anywhere.)
message.variable: ReadySHARE Cloud (Allows you to access ReadySHARE Storage from anywhere.)

message.translation: Print Sharing for Windows PCs and Mac Computers with a USB Printer
message.variable: Print Sharing for Windows PCs and Mac Computers with a USB Printer

message.translation: Step 1: Connect the USB printer to the router’s USB port with a USB printer cable.
message.variable: Step 1: Connect the USB printer to the router’s USB port with a USB printer cable.

message.translation: Step 2: Install the USB printer driver software on each computer that will share the printer.
message.variable: Step 2: Install the USB printer driver software on each computer that will share the printer.

message.translation: If you do not have the driver, contact the company that made the printer to locate and download the latest printer driver software.
message.variable: If you do not have the driver, contact the company that made the printer to locate and download the latest printer driver software.

message.translation: Step 3: On each computer that will share the printer, download the NETGEAR USB Control Center utility from http://www.netgear.com/readyshare.
message.variable: Step 3: On each computer that will share the printer, download the NETGEAR USB Control Center utility from http://www.netgear.com/readyshare.

message.translation: Follow the instructions in the utility to connect to the printer from your computer and print.
message.variable: Follow the instructions in the utility to connect to the printer from your computer and print.

message.translation: We can help you to recover the router’s admin password. Please complete the information below and click Continue.
message.variable: We can help you to recover the router’s admin password. Please complete the information below and click Continue.

message.translation: (You can find it on the router product label.)
message.variable: (You can find it on the router product label.)

message.translation: Please complete the answers to the two security questions below and click Continue.
message.variable: Please complete the answers to the two security questions below and click Continue.

message.translation: You have successfully recovered the admin password.
message.variable: You have successfully recovered the admin password.

message.translation: You can now log into the router using username \"admin\" and this recovered password.
message.variable: You can now log into the router using username \"admin\" and this recovered password.

message.translation: Click here to setup Inbound Firewall Rules for gaming or other applications
message.variable: Click here to setup Inbound Firewall Rules for gaming or other applications

message.translation: You are currently logged in from another device. There can be only one device logged in at a time. If you log in from this device, the other device will be logged out. Do you want to proceed?
message.variable: You are currently logged in from another device. There can be only one device logged in at a time. If you log in from this device, the other device will be logged out. Do you want to proceed?

message.translation: the Internet port is not connected
message.variable: the Internet port is not connected

message.translation: The Wizard sets most parameters to defaults as proposed by the VPN Consortium (VPNC), and assumes a pre-shared key, which greatly simplifies setup
message.variable: The Wizard sets most parameters to defaults as proposed by the VPN Consortium (VPNC), and assumes a pre-shared key, which greatly simplifies setup

message.translation: After creating the policies through the VPN Wizard, you can always update the parameters through the VPN setting links on the left menu
message.variable: After creating the policies through the VPN Wizard, you can always update the parameters through the VPN setting links on the left menu

message.translation: Step 1 of 3: Connection Name and Remote IP Type
message.variable: Step 1 of 3: Connection Name and Remote IP Type

message.variable: What is the new Connection Name?

message.variable: This VPN tunnel will connect to

message.variable: Step 2 of 3: Remote IP address or the Internet name

message.variable: What is the remote WAN's IP address or Internet name?

message.variable: Step 3 of 3: Secure Connection Remote Accessibility

message.variable: What is the remote LAN IP address and Subnet Mask?

message.variable: Please click "Done" to apply the changes.

message.variable: The following parameters are recommended by the VPNC and used in the VPN Wizard

message.translation: Note: Internet will be kept active until unregistered.
message.variable: Note: Internet will be kept active until unregistered.

message.translation:
The ReadySHARE Cloud feature gives you remote access over the Internet to a USB storage device that is connected to your router's USB port.

How to Set Up ReadySHARE Cloud

Step 1: You need a ReadySHARE Cloud account. If you do not have one,click here to get one.

Step 2: On this page, enter your ReadySHARE Cloud user name and password to register your router and the USB device that is connected to it with your account.

Step 3: Log back into http://readyshare.netgear.com/ with your account. You should see the USB device that is connected to your router.

Step 4: The first time, you are asked to download a Windows client, which is used to make a secure connection from your PC to the router's USB device. Log into this client and you can access the USB device from anywhere.

Note: Without this client, you can browse your USB device contents but you cannot open files or make changes to them
message.variable:
The ReadySHARE Cloud feature gives you remote access over the Internet to a USB storage device that is connected to your router's USB port.

How to Set Up ReadySHARE Cloud

Step 1: You need a ReadySHARE Cloud account. If you do not have one,click here to get one.

Step 2: On this page, enter your ReadySHARE Cloud user name and password to register your router and the USB device that is connected to it with your account.

Step 3: Log back into http://readyshare.netgear.com/ with your account. You should see the USB device that is connected to your router.

Step 4: The first time, you are asked to download a Windows client, which is used to make a secure connection from your PC to the router's USB device. Log into this client and you can access the USB device from anywhere.

Note: Without this client, you can browse your USB device contents but you cannot open files or make changes to them

message.translation: Start now to enable ReadySHARE Cloud
message.variable: Start now to enable ReadySHARE Cloud

message.translation: If you don't have a ReadySHARE Cloud account click here to get one.
message.variable: If you don't have a ReadySHARE Cloud account click here to get one.

message.translation: ReadySHARE Cloud is registered with user
message.variable: ReadySHARE Cloud is registered with user

message.translation: You can follow step 2~4 above to access the storage from anywhere
message.variable: You can follow step 2~4 above to access the storage from anywhere

message.translation: Click Unregister to register ReadySHARE Cloud with a different user
message.variable: Click Unregister to register ReadySHARE Cloud with a different user
